Chief Operating Officer (COO) Job at DET Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        DET Consulting Limited is a Human Resource and Outsourcing solutions firm committed to helping organizations attract top talent, optimize workforce performance, and drive business growth. We specialize in recruitment, staff outsourcing, HR advisory, training, and payroll services, delivering customized solutions that align with organizational goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer (COO)
Job Location: Atan, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Chief Operating Officer (COO) will oversee the day-to-day manufacturing and recycling operations of the company, ensuring operational efficiency, cost optimization, safety compliance, and consistent production performance in line with business objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and supervise daily plant and recycling operations.
	Develop and implement operational strategies to improve productivity and efficiency.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, environmental, and regulatory standards.
	Oversee production planning, quality control, and equipment maintenance.
	Lead and manage operational teams to achieve performance targets.
	Monitor operational costs and drive continuous process improvement.
	Work closely with the CEO/MD on strategic and operational decisions.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Operations Management, Business Administration, or related field (Master’s Degree is an added advantage).
	5 – 7 years of relevant experience in manufacturing or recycling operations.
	Strong leadership, operational, and problem-solving skills.
	Proven experience managing production teams and plant operations.
	Excellent communication and decision-making abilities.


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should p send their CV to: info.detconsultingltd@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resource Manager (HRM)",
  "description": "DET Consulting Limited is a Human Resource and Outsourcing solutions firm committed to helping organizations attract top talent, optimize workforce performance, and drive business growth. We specialize in recruitment, staff outsourcing, HR advisory, training, and payroll services, delivering customized solutions that align with organizational goals. Our mission is simple: Empowering people, transforming businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager (HRM)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a strategic and people-oriented Human Resource Manager to lead and manage all HR functions within the organization.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for talent acquisition, employee relations, performance management, policy development, and creating a positive, productive work environment aligned with the company&rsquo;s goals.


Responsibilities
Recruitment &amp; Talent Management:


	Manage end-to-end recruitment, selection, and onboarding processes.
	Develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract top talent.
	Maintain a talent pipeline for critical roles.
	Coordinate orientation and ensure seamless employee integration.


Employee Relations:


	Serve as the primary point of contact for all employee concerns.
	Foster a positive and inclusive workplace culture.
	Manage workplace conflict using fair and effective HR practices.
	Conduct periodic employee feedback and engagement initiatives.


Performance Management:


	Implement and monitor performance management systems.
	Support managers in setting KPIs and conducting performance reviews.
	Identify high-performing employees for development and succession planning.
	Recommend corrective actions where necessary.


Learning &amp; Development:


	Conduct training needs assessments across departments.
	Plan and organize relevant training programmes for staff.
	Track the effectiveness of learning initiatives.
	Promote continuous professional development.


HR Policies &amp; Compliance:


	Develop, update, and enforce company HR policies and procedures.
	Ensure full compliance with Nigerian labour laws and regulations.
	Prepare HR reports and present insights to management.
	Maintain accurate and confidential employee records.


Compensation &amp; Benefits:


	Support the development and implementation of remuneration structures.
	Oversee payroll input accuracy in collaboration with the finance team.
	Recommend employee welfare initiatives and benefit programs.
	Manage leave administration.


Strategic HR Support:


	Participate in strategic planning meetings with management.
	Provide HR insights to support business decisions.
	Lead HR projects such as culture transformation, engagement drives, and process automation.


Requirements&nbsp;


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in human resources, Business Administration, or any related field.
	4 &ndash; 7 years of proven experience as an HR Generalist or HR Manager.
	Strong knowledge of HR best practices and Nigerian labour laws.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills.

Human Resource Manager (HRM) Job at DET Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        DET Consulting Limited is a Human Resource and Outsourcing solutions firm committed to helping organizations attract top talent, optimize workforce performance, and drive business growth. We specialize in recruitment, staff outsourcing, HR advisory, training, and payroll services, delivering customized solutions that align with organizational goals. Our mission is simple: Empowering people, transforming businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager (HRM)

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a strategic and people-oriented Human Resource Manager to lead and manage all HR functions within the organization.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for talent acquisition, employee relations, performance management, policy development, and creating a positive, productive work environment aligned with the company’s goals.


Responsibilities
Recruitment & Talent Management:


	Manage end-to-end recruitment, selection, and onboarding processes.
	Develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract top talent.
	Maintain a talent pipeline for critical roles.
	Coordinate orientation and ensure seamless employee integration.


Employee Relations:


	Serve as the primary point of contact for all employee concerns.
	Foster a positive and inclusive workplace culture.
	Manage workplace conflict using fair and effective HR practices.
	Conduct periodic employee feedback and engagement initiatives.


Performance Management:


	Implement and monitor performance management systems.
	Support managers in setting KPIs and conducting performance reviews.
	Identify high-performing employees for development and succession planning.
	Recommend corrective actions where necessary.


Learning & Development:


	Conduct training needs assessments across departments.
	Plan and organize relevant training programmes for staff.
	Track the effectiveness of learning initiatives.
	Promote continuous professional development.


HR Policies & Compliance:


	Develop, update, and enforce company HR policies and procedures.
	Ensure full compliance with Nigerian labour laws and regulations.
	Prepare HR reports and present insights to management.
	Maintain accurate and confidential employee records.


Compensation & Benefits:


	Support the development and implementation of remuneration structures.
	Oversee payroll input accuracy in collaboration with the finance team.
	Recommend employee welfare initiatives and benefit programs.
	Manage leave administration.


Strategic HR Support:


	Participate in strategic planning meetings with management.
	Provide HR insights to support business decisions.
	Lead HR projects such as culture transformation, engagement drives, and process automation.


Requirements 


	Bachelor’s Degree in human resources, Business Administration, or any related field.
	4 – 7 years of proven experience as an HR Generalist or HR Manager.
	Strong knowledge of HR best practices and Nigerian labour laws.
